title: "Unable to connect to server" only when on mobile (4G) internet?
body:
Sometimes if my internet happens to go down I'll connect to my phone's 4G internet. Regardless of whether I did this via WiFi or via USB I got the aforementioned error 5-6 times before I gave up. Firewall is turned off. No anti-virus.

Can't think what this could be. Anyone encountered this issue before?

replies.body: This happens to me too! it started around patch 5.22 for me and before that it was perfectly fine. Usually restarting my whole computer works but that's time consuming. Other times i usually have to keep re-opening my launcher until it works which is usually 5-6 times. When I'm in game though, there are times where i freeze still which lasts forever pretty much and when i leave and try to reconnect, it usually comes up with the error which then leads to me spending about 10 minutes trying to get in again. I've tried refreshing DNS and repairing and none of them seem to work. If anyone could help would be great.

Hey FrozenFlame, 

When this happens, you might want to try to restart your client, as sometimes the client throws that error repeatedly until you restart your client. Otherwise, your phone might be blocking certain ports. It's really hard to tell. If it happens again, try running a Tracert to the League of Legends servers (guide linked below). 

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs

Cheers!
I see. Thanks for your help guys. If it happens again I'll give that a go and see what works. Cheers!
